verses.plain: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.

tokens.t: Truly God
good to Israel,
to such as are of a clean heart.

verses.plain: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

tokens.t: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

verses.plain: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

tokens.t: For I was envious at the foolish,
I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

verses.plain: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.

tokens.t: For
no bands in their death: but their strength
firm.

verses.plain: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.

tokens.t: They
not in trouble
men; neither are they plagued like
men.

verses.plain: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.

tokens.t: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them
a garment.

verses.plain: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

tokens.t: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

verses.plain: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.

tokens.t: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly
oppression: they speak loftily.

verses.plain: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

tokens.t: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

verses.plain: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.

tokens.t: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full
are wrung out to them.

verses.plain: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

tokens.t: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

verses.plain: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

tokens.t: Behold, these
the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase
riches.

verses.plain: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

tokens.t: Verily I have cleansed my heart
vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

verses.plain: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

tokens.t: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

verses.plain: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.

tokens.t: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend
the generation of thy children.

verses.plain: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;

tokens.t: When I thought to know this, it
too painful for me;

verses.plain: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.

tokens.t: Until I went into the sanctuary of God;
understood I their end.

verses.plain: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.

tokens.t: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.

verses.plain: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

tokens.t: How are they
into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

verses.plain: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

tokens.t: As a dream when
awaketh;
, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

verses.plain: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

tokens.t: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

verses.plain: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.

tokens.t: So foolish
I, and ignorant: I was
a beast before thee.

verses.plain: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.

tokens.t: Nevertheless I
continually with thee: thou hast holden
by my right hand.

verses.plain: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.

tokens.t: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me
glory.

verses.plain: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.

tokens.t: Whom have I in heaven
? and
none upon earth
I desire beside thee.

verses.plain: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

tokens.t: My flesh and my heart faileth:
God
the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

verses.plain: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.

tokens.t: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.

verses.plain: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.

tokens.t: But
good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord
, that I may declare all thy works.

footnotes.text: in…: Heb. in the trouble of other men
have…: Heb. pass the thoughts of the heart
too…: Heb. labour in mine eyes
